Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a string telephone using clear illustrations of two students at either end, demonstrating communication over a distance.
The student can clearly illustrate the path of sound travel through the string using well-placed arrows or lines, effectively showing the direction and flow of sound.
The student can correctly identify and label all components of the string telephone, including cups and string, ensuring clarity in their representation.
The student can demonstrate the importance of sound as a method of communication within their illustration, possibly adding contextual elements (e.g., one student talking and the other listening).
The student can include a concise and accurate label or note explaining why the string telephone is effective for communicating over a distance, referencing properties of sound travel.
CANNOT: There are no major elements the student is unable to show at this level, but there might be minor gaps like inconsistent arrow sizes or slightly imprecise labeling (though these do not detract from overall understanding).
